intro: Striga canescens, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a small, annual herb with a creeping stem and a dense mat of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Striga canescens is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
